data.title: Late diff decorations in rulers and diff editor
data.body:
- VSCode Version: Code - Insiders 1.8.0-insider (25dc9851ef6d41fb4939a37312590cadaee90327, 2016-12-08T21:42:14.353Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 15.6.0
- Extensions:

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|EditorConfig|EditorConfig|0.3.4|
|autofilename|JerryHong|0.1.3|
|vscode-docker|PeterJausovec|0.0.7|
|regex|chrmarti|0.0.7|
|vscode-eslint|dbaeumer|1.1.0|
|ghlink|dt|0.0.4|
|tslint|eg2|0.6.0|
|vscode-scss|mrmlnc|0.6.0|
|PowerShell|ms-vscode|0.7.2|
|debugger-for-chrome|msjsdiag|2.2.2|
|diff|rafaelmaiolla|0.0.1|
|vscode-open-in-github|sysoev|1.2.1|

---

It took several minutes for the annotations to show up. It reproduces on window reload. Note that the 4 lines starting with copyLinesUp have changes that are not decorated properly:
![screen shot 2016-12-08 at 3 55 17 pm](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/9205389/21032605/5ca14b3e-bd5f-11e6-94e4-c4ade065692c.png)

I also didn't see change annotations in the rulers. Not sure if this might depend on an external system, but since the revision history is local, I would expect it not to.

data.title: Save all will perform paste operation
data.body:
- VSCode Version:1.7.2
- OS Version:Windows 10

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Open two files in VS code, I get this issue with html, css, js and ts files.
2. Edit file 1, make it dirty but do not save
3. Switch to the other file then click "Save All" from main menu or from the side bar
4. The dirty file was saved, but the content of the dirty file will paste to current file editor. 

Actually this is not a new issue, I found it in early version as well.

data.title: Fresh install of Visual Studio Code does not launch
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.7.2-1479766213
- OS Version: CentOS7 (64)

Steps to Reproduce:

1. Install VS Code via .rpm
2. Open a terminal and run "code ."
3. See that it returns `/usr/share/code/bin/../code: error while loading shared libraries: libXss.so.1: cannot open shared object file: No such file or directory`.

data.title: Zooming UI
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.8.0 - insider
- OS Version: Windows


-- Sorry for the English, I used Google Translator --

Based on issue #14979 with  [comment](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/14979#issuecomment-259390808).


1- Ctrl + + It should zoom in on the editor, the file we're moving, not the zoom of the whole program.
2- Ctrl + - You should zoom out within the editor, the file you are moving, not the zoom of the entire program.
3- Ctrl + 0 You should zoom back to the default, the file you are moving, not the zoom of the entire program.

4- Ctr + +, Ctr + - should work the same way when we use "editor.mouseWheelZoom", by only zooming the file. And using Ctrl + 0 returns to the default.

5- Ctr + = You should do nothing. The zoom continues. You must unlink this function.
6- Ctrl + 0 of the non-numeric keyboard does not reset the zoom.


These shortcut keys should be valid for both numeric and non-numeric keys. In the menu you should change the registration `Ctr + =` by `Ctrl + +`


Why not set specific sizes for the UI? Maybe some [problems ](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode/issues/14979#issuecomment-265772474)mentioned by @alexandrudima would decrease!!

>In fact I am 100% in favor of eliminating the entire UI zoom we're shipping with, it causes many issues with font anti-aliasing for example and I have to maintain extraneous code to work around it (i.e. not using translate3d when the UI zoom is not 100%)



Example: Small, Normal, Large, Extra large. To set proportions, do a search with someone who uses sizes other than their normal size.

data.title: Add telemetry event for hot exit triggered
Looking for information on debugging a node C++ addon using nan and node-gyp
data.body:
I'm having problems finding documentation on how to debug a node C++ addon using nan and node-gyp. 

There are articles to [debug JavaScript](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode-node-debug) and [C++ applications](https://code.visualstudio.com/docs/languages/cpp), but I cannot seem to find an example of how to configure vscode to use node-gyp instead of g++ plus how to test calling between JavaScript and C++.

As a starting point, is it currently possible to debug node C++ addons with vscode and if so, is there an example project or documentation to reference?

I've been using vscode for JavaScript and loving it...now I'm hoping to do the same for node addons!

data.title: editor.formatOnSave adds and then removes spaces to function definitions, cluttering up the diff
data.body:
I have editor.formatOnSave set to true, as it is typically very useful for the Node project I am working on. However, this function sometimes decides to add a space between "function" and the argument list (for example, `var myFunc = function (a,b){...`), and other times decides NO space (ie `var myFunc = function(a,b){...`). This litters the diff with meaningless changes and causes a good deal of frustration.

---

- VSCode Version: Code 1.7.2 (7ba55c5860b152d999dda59393ca3ebeb1b5c85f, 2016-11-21T22:01:10.756Z)
- OS Version: Darwin x64 15.6.0
- Extensions:

|Extension|Author|Version|
|---|---|---|
|theme-onedark|azemoh|0.4.0|
|jshint|dbaeumer|0.10.15|
|Theme-snappy-light|gerane|0.0.2|
|vscode-exec-node|miramac|0.1.8|
|cpptools|ms-vscode|0.9.2|
|seti-icons|qinjia|0.1.3|

---

Steps to Reproduce:

1. set `editor.formatOnSave: true` in settings.json
2. work on a file, save it, commit/push, work on it some more, save it again. This won't happen every time, but frequently.

data.title: Adopt configurationSnippets in debug adapter
data.body:
In order to have a nice add configuration experience it would be great if as many debug adapters adopt the configurationSnippets attribute in launch.json
Examples: [node debug](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode-node-debug/blob/master/package.json#L95), [mock debug](https://github.com/Microsoft/vscode-mock-debug/blob/master/package.json#L71)

Commit e0871329738682651367be4e8a618912ad693e03
Date 2016-12-08T07:04:29.620Z

data.title: Debug: start and then attach is still weird
data.body:
Steps to Reproduce:

1. start the smoke test app and notice the debug widget toolbar 
2. now pick the attach config
3. run it

=> the debug widget toolbar changes to a dropdown with only 1 entry
=> the dropdown does not contain the attach
=> when attach fails the dropdown does not go away

![untitled](https://cloud.githubusercontent.com/assets/900690/21016334/7e939034-bd65-11e6-8c44-36c1f80c467a.gif)

data.title: Debug dropdown: selecting an entry should not launch it
data.body:
Steps to Reproduce:

1. make a selection change in the debug viewlet launch dropdown 
2. the selection change seems to trigger a start?

From the looks of that widget, this is not what I would expect.

data.title: Remove message insider builds are becoming daily builds
Copy path from editor tabs
data.body:
Right now we can copy a file's path from the explorer pane, but it would be great to have the same right-click context menu items available in the editor tab as well. I tend to leave the explorer pane minimized and a couple of editors open side-by-side, so if I need to copy a file path it's inconvenient to have to open the explorer pane and then right-click the file name in the open editors list.

Thanks and keep up the good work!

data.title: Increase size of stop icon
data.body: To be the same size as attach and the other icons. Currently it looks too small

data.title: Maximize current file/tab/editor
data.body:
- VSCode Version: 1.7.2
- OS Version: Linux Mint

I've looked a bit but couldn't find a solution. Is there a way to toggle maximize (full screen) only the current tab/file? Even if there is split editor, it shouldn't display it, only the current file/tab.

Thanks
